histogram.name: Cryptohome.AsyncDBusRequest
histogram.summary: Records the total running time of every async dbus calls of Cryptohome at server side.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.AsyncDBusRequest.Inqueue
histogram.summary: Records the total inqueue time of every async dbus calls of Cryptohome at server side. Recorded when the first stage of this requests is served.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.ChecksumStatus
histogram.summary: Checksum status of critical persistent data used by Cryptohome. This status is recorded every time the cryptohomed daemon reads a file.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DeletedUserProfiles
histogram.summary: In low disk space scenarios, Cryptohome erases whole user profiles. This is a number of user profiles deleted during cleanup. Only reported when non-zero.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DeprecatedApiCalled
histogram.summary: Records when a deprecated API function in cryptohome is called, so we know which exposed DBus API can be removed without side effect.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationEndStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once at the end of each migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationFailedErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of file operation by which the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto has failed. This is logged once the migration encounters a file I/O error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationFailedOperationType
histogram.summary: The type of file operation at which the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto has failed. This is logged once the migration encounters a file I/O error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationFailedPathType
histogram.summary: The category of the path where the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto has failed. This is logged once the migration encounters a file I/O error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationInitialFreeSpaceInMb
histogram.summary: The total amount of free disk space on the system when the user started the migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is only logged when the user encounters an insufficient space error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationNoSpaceFailureFreeSpaceInMb
histogram.summary: The total amount of free disk space on the system when the user received an insufficient space error during the migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is only logged when the user encounters an insufficient space error.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationNoSpaceXattrSizeInBytes
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes of xattr data that we are trying to store on a file when we receive an insufficient space error. This includes both xattr data already present on the file as well as the new xattr we are trying to set. This is only logged during ecryptfs to ext4-crypto migration if we receive an insufficient space error when setting a new extended attribute.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationStartStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the user home directory migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once at the start of each migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationTotalByteCountInMb
histogram.summary: The total byte count (MB) of the data in a user's home directory which is being migrated from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once when a new migration starts.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMigrationTotalFileCount
histogram.summary: The total file count in a user's home directory which is being migrated from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once when a new migration starts.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMinimalMigrationEndStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the user home directory minimal migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once at the end of each minimal migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DircryptoMinimalMigrationStartStatus
histogram.summary: The status of the user home directory minimal migration from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. This is logged once at the start of each minimal migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DiskCleanupProgress
histogram.summary: In low disk space scenarios, Cryptohome erases caches while target amount of free disk space is not reached. It starts from low priority categories. This histogram reports which topmost priority was reached to fulfill a cleanup request.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.DiskCleanupResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of triggering disk cleanup.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.Errors
histogram.summary: Cryptohome errors.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.EvkkEncryptionType
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Cryptohome.WrappingKeyDerivation.Mount 2021-03-08 which describes the derivation types more comprehensively.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Encrypted Vault Keyset Key (EVKK) is TPM wrapped. This is reported when the Derive function inside scrypt auth block or TPM auth block is called, which happens during cryptohome mount phase.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.FreedCacheVaultDiskSpaceInMb
histogram.summary: This is an amount of Dmcrypt cache vault space (MB) which was evicted by cryptohome due to shortage of remaining disk space. Reported only if something was deleted (greater than zero).

histogram.name: Cryptohome.FreeDiskSpaceTotalFreedInMb
histogram.summary: In low disk space scenarios, Cryptohome performs a lot of disk space operations to erase data. This is the amount of space that was released by the automatic cleanup.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.FreeDiskSpaceTotalTime2
histogram.summary: In low disk space scenarios, Cryptohome performs a lot of disk space operations to erase data. This is a number of milliseconds taken to perform a cleanup. Reported only if longer than 5 ms. Increased maximum and number of buckets compared to FreeDiskSpaceTotalTime.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.GCache.FreedDiskSpaceInMb
histogram.summary: This is an amount of Google Drive cache (MB) which was evicted by cryptohome due to shortage of remaining disk space. Reported only if something was deleted (greater than zero).

histogram.name: Cryptohome.HomedirEncryptionType
histogram.summary: The encryption type used for a user's cryptohome directory. This is logged each time the cryptohome is mounted.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.InvalidateDirCryptoKeyResult
histogram.summary: The errors resulting from interacting with the InvalidateDirCryptoKey operation.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.LECredential
histogram.summary: Events related to Low Entropy (LE) credential management. These are logged every time an operation involving a LE credential is performed.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.LegacyCodePathUsage.{Location}
histogram.summary: This will report usage of {Location} paths to see if it is actually being used or not to enable us to decide if we want to continue supporting {Location} or not.

variant.name: AddKeyResetSeedGeneration
variant.summary: Reset seed generated during Add Key operation

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationToGaiaId
histogram.summary: This is the status of cryptohome migration to GaiaId. Every time user logs in current migration status is recorded.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.ConsumedBatteryPercent
histogram.summary: The amount of consumed battery level during cryptohome encryption migration. This is logged when the battery level decreases during migration, and the data is used to check if the minimum battery level required to start migration is appropriate.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.FirstScreen
histogram.summary: The first screen in the encryption migration UI, which is shown when a user attempts to log in to the system and old encryption (eCryptfs) is detected.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.MigrationResult
histogram.summary: The result of encryption migration from eCryptfs to Ext4 dircrypto. The recorded result is what the migration UI in Chrome side is notified from cryptohomed.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.RemoveCryptohomeResult
histogram.summary: The result of the removal of user's cryptohome. When the migration UI is notified that the migration failed, the UI tries to remove the user's cryptohome to make sure that the user can create clean crytohome directory in the next sign-in.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.UserChoice
histogram.summary: User's choice when the system is ready to migrate encryption. The user can start migration or skip it. It is used to know how many users have skipped migration.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.MigrationUI.VisibleScreen
histogram.summary: How many times each screen in migration UI is shown to the user. A screen is recorded as a visible screen when the screen is kept displayed at least for a second.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.OOPMountCleanupResult
histogram.summary: The result of a cryptohome out-of-process mount cleanup. Recorded once per logout.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.OOPMountOperationResult
histogram.summary: The result of a cryptohome out-of-process mount operation. Recorded once per login attempt.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.ParallelTasks
histogram.summary: How many tasks runs in parallel typically in the mount thread of cryptohome. Recorded when a requests comes in. Counts of 1 will not reported.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.RestoreSELinuxContextResultForHome
histogram.summary: The result of a cryptohome restore SELinux context operation of user home directory /home/.shadow/salted-hash and its subdirectories. Recorded once per login attempt.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.RestoreSELinuxContextResultForShadow
histogram.summary: The result of a cryptohome restore SELinux context operation of shadow directory /home/.shadow and its subdirectories. Recorded on a user's first login on a device or login after factory reset.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeBetweenFreeDiskSpace
histogram.summary: The amount of time (s) between disk cleanup runs. If there is sufficient disk space, nothing is reported. The first cleanup run after boot is not reported.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeSessionUnlock
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome daemon to verify the user's password during an unlock operation.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToCompleteDircryptoMigration
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for the user's home directory to be migrated from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto. If the migration is interrupted and subsequently resumed (such as due to power loss) then no value is recorded for either attempt.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToCompleteDircryptoMinimalMigration
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for the user's home directory to be migrated from ecryptfs to ext4-crypto if the minimal migration method was used. If the minimal migration is interrupted and subsequently resumed (such as due to power loss) then no value is recorded for either attempt.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToGenerateEccAuthValue
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for the ECC auth value generating process. It should perform within a certain window: faster than the RSA implementation, but not too fast (less than 100ms) to brute force. This metrics would be recorded when user trying to login to the Chrome OS with the TPM ECC auth block and only available on TPM2.0 devices.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToInitPkcs11
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome daemon to initialize the PKCS#11. Initializations under 1 second represent checks on a previously initialized PKCS#11, and should be discarded for analysis.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountEx
histogram.summary: The amount of time for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted home directory.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountGuestAsync
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted guest home directory asynchronously.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToMountGuestEx
histogram.summary: The amount of time for Chrome OS cryptohome to mount the encrypted guest home directory.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToPerformEphemeralMount
histogram.summary: The amount of time cryptohome spends actively performing mounts when creating an ephemeral user data directory. Does not include any process or async dispatch overhead.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToPerformMount
histogram.summary: The amount of time cryptohome spends performing the mounts for the user's encrypted home directory. Does not include any process or async dispatch overhead.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToPerformOOPMountCleanup
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) cryptohome spends terminating and reaping the out-of-process mounter, which includes the time spent by the mounter itself tearing down the user home directory.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToPerformOOPMountOperation
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) cryptohome spends running the out-of-process mounter, until the user home directory is finalized.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TimeToTakeTpmOwnership
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) for Chrome OS cryptohome daemon to take ownership of the TPM.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.TpmResults
histogram.summary: The errors resulting from interacting with the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) device.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.UserSubdirHasCorrectGroup
histogram.summary: Records whether the user's profile directory (/home/chronos/u-{hash}) is owned by group chronos-access. This is recorded once per log-in.

histogram.name: Cryptohome.WrappingKeyDerivation.Create
histogram.summary: Derivation types of the Cryptohome's wrapping key. Reporting happens when the Cryptohome is being created or when the new keys are added to the existing Cryptohome. Concretely during a user creation, password change, registration of a new authentication method (e.g. PIN), migration from scrypt to TPM/GSC (in case the security chip becomes available later).

histogram.name: Cryptohome.WrappingKeyDerivation.Mount
histogram.summary: Derivation types of the Cryptohome's wrapping key. Reporting happens mostly when the Cryptohome is being mounted. Concretely the reporting happens during a user creation, registration/removal of an authentication methods (e.g. PIN), user login, password change, migration from scrypt to TPM/GSC (in case the security chip becomes available later).

histogram.name: Cryptohome.{Action}AuthBlockType
histogram.summary: The type of auth block that we {Action} in cryptohome. Recorded when cryptohome accesses the auth block.

histogram.name: CryptohomeClient
histogram.summary: Records the time duration of every dbus outgoing calls issued from the client of Crypthome in Chrome side.
